oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uncle Tom RCA-Victor Record Show - 1948-10-30 - Voice track
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: "Uncle Tom" Moore's transcribed voice track for the RCA-Victor Record Show to be broadcast October 30, 1948 over WNOX, Knoxville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Uncle Tom) -- Uncle Tom introduces Eddy Arnold record 'A Heart Full Of Love' -- Uncle Tom introduces Blue Sky Boys record 'Chapel In The Hills' -- Uncle Tom introduces Elton Britt record 'Anyone' -- Uncle Tom introduces Georgia Crackers record 'Broken Doll' -- Uncle Tom introduces Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys record 'Say Good Morning, Nellie' -- Uncle Tom introduces Eddy Arnold record 'Then I Turned And Slowly Walked Away' -- Closing statement (Uncle Tom)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WNOX (Radio station : Knoxville, Tenn.); Moore, Tom (Uncle Tom)
